text.0: may they who would assume kinship from far away vivasvāns generations dearly loved of men.
text.1: even the gods who sit upon the sacred grass of nahuṣas son yayāti bless and comfort us.
text.2: for worthy of obeisance gods are all your names worthy of adoration and of sacrifice.
text.3: ye who were born from waters and from aditi and from the earth do ye here listen to my call.
text.4: i will rejoice in these Ādityas for my weal for whom the mother pours forth water rich in balm.
text.5: and dyaus the infinite firm as a rock sweet milkgods active strong through lauds whose might the bull upholds.
text.6: looking on men neer slumbering they by their deserts attained as gods to lofty immortality.
text.7: borne on refulgent cars sinless with serpents powers they robe them for our welfare in the height of heaven.
text.8: great kings who bless us who have come to sacrifice who neer assailed have set their mansion in the sky.
text.9: these i invite with adoration and with hymns mighty Ādityas aditi for happiness.
text.10: who offereth to you the laud that ye accept o ye allgods of manu many as ye are.
text.11: who mighty ones will prepare for you the sacrifice to bear us over trouble to felicity.
text.12: ye to whom manu by seven priests with kindled fire offered the first oblation with his heart and soul.
text.13: vouchsafe us ye Ādityas sheitcr free from fear and make us good and easy paths to happiness.
text.14: wise deities who have dominion oer the world ye thinkers over all that moves not and that moves.
text.15: save us from uncommitted and committed sin preserve us from all sin today for happiness.
text.16: in battles we invoke indra still swift to hear and all the holy host of heaven who banish grief.
text.17: agni mitra and varuṇa that we may gain dyays bhaga maruts prthivi for happiness.
text.18: mightilysaving earth incomparable heaven the good guide aditi who gives secure defence.
text.19: the welloared heavenly ship that lets no waters in free from defect will we ascend for happiness.
text.20: bless us all holy ones that we may have your help guard and protect us from malignant injury.
text.21: with fruitful invocation may we call on you gods who give ear to us for grace for happiness.
text.22: keep all disease afar and sordid sacrifice keep off the wicked mans malicious enmity.
text.23: keep far away from us all hatred o ye gods and give us ample shelter for our happiness.
text.24: untouched by any evil every mortal thrives and following the law spreads in his progeny.
text.25: whom ye with your good guidance o Ādityas lead safely through all his pain and grief to happiness.
text.26: that which ye guard and grace in battle o ye gods ye maruts where the prize is wealth where heroes win.
text.27: that conquering car o indra that sets forth at dawn that never breaks may we ascend for happiness.
text.28: vouchsafe us blessing in our paths and desert tracts blessing in waters and in battle for the light.
text.29: blessing upon the wombs that bring male children forth and blessing o ye maruts for the gain of wealth.
text.30: the noblest svasti with abundant riches who comes to what is good by distant pathway.
text.31: may she at home and far away preserve us and dwell with us under the gods protection.
text.32: thus hatb the thoughtful sage the son of plati praised you o aditi and all Ādityas.
text.33: men are made rich by those who are immortal the heavenly folk have been extolled by gaya.
